Line 44: Line 44:
==Branding and controversy==
==Branding and controversy==
[[File:United Airlines.svg|thumb|left|250px|United's old logo featuring the iconic 38 year-old Saul Bass designed "Tulip" was used until March 2011]]
[[File:United Airlines.svg|thumb|left|250px|United's old logo featuring the iconic 38 year-old Saul Bass designed "Tulip" was used until March 2011]]
â
[[File:United Airlines 2010 logo.svg|thumb|left|250px|The combined airline logo]]
+
At the time of the announcement in May 2010, [[United Airlines]] and [[Continental Airlines]] used a new United logo. It featured the words, "United Airlines" in the current [[Continental Airlines|Continental]] typeface, as well as still maintaining Continental's globe like emblem. In August 2010, the font was changed to United's upper-case sans-serif font, and the single word, UNITED. displayed<ref>[http://www.unitedcontinentalmerger.com/snapshots#/0 ]{{dead link|date=February 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=Posted Aug 12th 2010 05:13 PM |url=http://news.travel.aol.com/2010/08/12/united-continental-show-off-new-livery/ |title=United, Continental Show Off New Livery - AOL Travel News |publisher=News.travel.aol.com |date=2010-08-12 |accessdate=2011-02-12}}</ref>
At the time of the announcement in May 2010, [[United Airlines]] and [[Continental Airlines]] used a new United logo. It featured the words, "United Airlines" in the current [[Continental Airlines|Continental]] typeface, as well as still maintaining Continental's globe like emblem. In August 2010, the font was changed to United's upper-case sans-serif font, and the single word, UNITED. displayed<ref>[http://www.unitedcontinentalmerger.com/snapshots#/0 ]{{dead link|date=February 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=Posted Aug 12th 2010 05:13 PM |url=http://news.travel.aol.com/2010/08/12/united-continental-show-off-new-livery/ |title=United, Continental Show Off New Livery - AOL Travel News |publisher=News.travel.aol.com |date=2010-08-12 |accessdate=2011-02-12}}</ref>
